articles.author: Sk
articles.description:
Zapier‚Äôs claim of "800+ AI agents" is absurd.

If these were real agents, it wouldn‚Äôt be 800 of them; it‚Äôd be one agent with 800 tools. But ‚Äúworkflow‚Äù doesn‚Äôt sound as sexy or sell as well as ‚ÄúAI agent,‚Äù so we lie. Marketing, right?
A real agent (Claude, GPT, etc.) is not a glorified SHOULD BE regex parser with an LLM slapped on top.
And just for context, I‚Äôm actually building an agentic tool in Go for smaller models, so I think I‚Äôve earned a bit of leeway to talk about this.
What Actually Is an Agent?
Is an Agent Under the Hood?


Letting LLMs Return JSON
The "Read File" Tool Pattern
Real-World Example
An Email Example
So‚Ä¶ 800 Agents?
Final Thought
Is an Agent?


At its core, an AI agent is a large language model that orchestrates decisions in real time. It doesn‚Äôt just spit out text, It ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Workflows Are Not AI Agents: Selling Lies

AI-Powered Market Research & Content Generation with Runner H**  
Objective:


To demonstrate how Runner H can autonomously conduct market research, analyze trends, and generate high-quality content‚Äîstreamlining tasks that typically take hours into minutes.  
Workflow Overview




Task: Competitive analysis for a new eco-friendly water bottle brand.


Runner H‚Äôs Role:


Scrape & analyze competitor data (pricing, features, reviews).

Generate a SWOT analysis.

Write a blog post on "Top 5 Sustainable Water Bottles in 2024."









  
  
  Step-by-Step Execution



  
  
  1. Data Collection (Competitor Research)


Prompt to Runner H:  
"Scrape and analyze the top 5 eco-friendly water bottle brands (e.g., Hydro Flask, S‚Äôwell, Klean Kanteen). Extract key features, pri‚Ä¶
articles.title: AI-POWERED MARKET RESEARCH AND CONTENT GENERATION WITH RUNNER-H

articles.author: n mani
articles.description:
From üì© to üìà: Automating Email Reports into Visual Insights
Inbox-analytics is a smart email-based reporting dashboard that processes inbound emails with CSV or Excel attachments (like sales reports or customer data). It automatically parses and visualizes these attachments into an interactive, analytics-rich dashboard‚Äîno manual downloads or spreadsheets required.
This tool helps teams instantly generate actionable insights from emailed reports using AI, charts, summaries, and anomaly detection.
üß† Key Features:
Automatic parsing of CSV and XLSX files
Interactive dashboards with visualizations (Plotly, Streamlit)
AI-powered insights using GPT
No manual downloads or Excel wrangling needed
Live App: 
https://inbox-analytics-engine-dasboard.onrender.com
https://inbox-analytics-engine.onrende‚Ä¶
articles.title: Inbox Analytics - You‚Äôve Got Mail‚Ä¶ and Dashboards! üìäüì¨

articles.author: Raj Aryan
articles.description:
üì¢ Disclaimer: This article is for informational purposes only and does not constitute financial, legal, or investment advice. Always consult a certified financial advisor before making any major financial decisions.
As software engineers, we focus so much on building great products that we forget to build one of the most important systems of all ‚Äî our financial future.
Set auto-debits for:
üõ° Emergency Fund (6+ months of expenses)
üìà SIPs into index or mutual funds
üè¶ Long-term schemes like PPF or NPS
Let your money grow while you sleep‚Äîjust like automated tests.
Use tools like:
INDMoney
TurtleMint
Or even Excel



Monitor assets, liabilities, and cash flow like you track logs and errors.
If you‚Äôre working in a startup or tech firm:
Understand your vesting schedule

Plan for taxes when selling
Diversify‚Äîdon‚Äôt put all your money in your employer‚Äôs stock
Just got a raise? Great. But avoid upgrading every part of your lifestyle.
Instead:
Increase SIPs
Buy a new book/course
Invest in health and upskilling
Buying a house can be tempting. But:
Consider flexibility and opportunity cost
EMI ‚â† ownership advantage if you‚Äôre constantly relocating
Run the math, not the emotion.
Books that helped me:
The Psychology of Money ‚Äî Morgan Housel
Let‚Äôs Talk Money ‚Äî Monika Halan (India-specific)
Rich Dad Poor Dad ‚Äî Robert Kiyosaki
Explore alternate income:
Start a micro-SaaS
Write blogs/tutorials
Monetize open source
Build a YouTube or newsletter audience
You‚Äôve mastered systems and logic. Now bring that same mastery to your money.
üîó Read the full, extended version with visuals on Medium:
https://er-raj-aryan.medium.com/financial-wisdom-for-software-engineers-build-code-build-wealth-0837e0319c2e
üì¢ Final Disclaimer: This article shares personal insights and should not be taken as financial advice. Always DYOR (Do Your Own Research) or consult a professional.
articles.title: üíºüí∞ Financial Wisdom for Software Engineers: Build Code, Build Wealth

articles.description:
Hey Python enthusiasts! üêç Ready to discover some game-changing resources that'll supercharge your development journey?
I've been reading Python newsletters for years, and I wanted to share the ones that have actually been worth my time. After testing 9 different newsletters, I've got some thoughts on which ones deliver real value and which ones... well, let's just say your inbox deserves better.
Here's my honest take on each one, ranked from the newsletters I actually look forward to reading down to the ones I'd probably unsubscribe from. If you're tired of sifting through mediocre content, this might help you find something worthwhile.
This newsletter started in May 2023 and combines AI filtering with human curation. Each issue includes 12 articles/tutorials and 12 projects, sourced from‚Ä¶

articles.author: Ujjwal Raj
articles.description:
Welcome to another Sunday article where we dive into system design.
As I‚Äôve already stated: we are going to learn the rules, follow the rules, and once you are an expert ‚Äî bend the rules.
Let‚Äôs keep track of what we‚Äôve learned so far, to keep things at our fingertips even if you haven‚Äôt read the previous article:
A good system design speaks (how components interact)
Avoid functional decomposition (what we were doing in universities)
The client should not be the core business. Let the client be the client ‚Äî not the system
Reduce coupling between services as much as possible
Decompose based on volatility
In this article, we will dive into volatility-based decomposition.
In the last blog, we compared volatility-based and functionally based decomposition of a mechanical car. Don‚Äôt worry if you‚Ä¶
articles.title: Volatility-Based Decomposition: A System Design Example

articles.author: Tushar
articles.description:
üöÄ Tired of losing quick notes or ideas in the chaos of sticky apps, terminals, and random tabs?
Instant Markdown Notes, a cross-platform desktop app that gives you a clean space to write and organize thoughts with zero distractions.
In this post, I share the why, how, and what's next behind this local-first tool. It features:
üìù A simple Markdown editor with live preview
‚è± Auto-saving notes with timestamps
üìÇ Daily files saved locally ‚Äî no cloud required
üéØ Global shortcut (Ctrl+Alt+N) to launch instantly
üß∞ Runs in the background with a tray icon
üßë‚Äçüíª Built with Electron + Vite
Whether you're capturing meeting notes, code snippets, or random brain dumps, this app gets out of your way and just lets you write. It‚Äôs built for devs, makers, and anyone who types faster than they think.
üì¨ Read the post to explore the journey and the open-source project ‚Äî and contribute if it speaks to you!
üëâ Read on Substack


  
  
  notetaking #opensource #electron #vite #productivitytools #devtools
articles.title: Instant Markdown Notes

articles.author: Mohit Decodes
articles.description:
AI is no longer a future trend ‚Äî it‚Äôs here, transforming how we build for the web.
In 2025, LLMs (Large Language Models) like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and open-source models are revolutionizing the web development workflow:
‚úÖ Writing code

‚úÖ Generating UI

‚úÖ Automating testing

‚úÖ Building chatbots

‚úÖ Personalizing user experiences

‚úÖ Accelerating learning  
In this post, let‚Äôs explore how LLMs are fundamentally changing web development.
LLMs are deep learning models trained on massive datasets of text & code.
They understand natural language and code.
Popular LLMs:



ChatGPT (OpenAI)
Claude (Anthropic)
Gemini (Google DeepMind)
LLaMA (Meta)
Mistral
Mixtral (mix of experts)
Many more open-source models!
GitHub Copilot, Codeium, Cursor IDE:


Generate boilerplate code
Autocomplete React comp‚Ä¶
articles.title: üß† How LLMs (Large Language Models) Are Changing Web Development in 2025

articles.author: Muhammad Salman
articles.description:
The problem every developer knows


You build something cool. Clean code, great architecture, solid product. Then you realize: people need to actually know it exists.
So you open Canva. Stare at blank templates. Spend 3 hours making something that looks... fine. Maybe. Your designer friend politely says "it's a good start" (translation: it sucks).
Or you post on Upwork: "Need simple Facebook ad, $50 budget." Get 47 responses. Pick someone. Wait 5 days. Get something generic that could be advertising literally any SaaS.
I was procrastinating on creating ads (again) when I realized: My website already has my brand. The colors, fonts, logo, even the way I write. 
What if AI could just... extract all that and create the ads for me?
Not generic AI templates. Actually good ads that understand MY‚Ä¶
articles.title: I got tired of paying $200 for ugly Facebook ads. So I built an AI to do it instead.
